question.title: How to get the right timezone in Java with ZonedDateTime?
question.body:
My front-end send me a datetime string with an offset in a Post Mapping, such as : 2024-04-12T10:39:23+02:00 My goal is to map this datetime in my backend (java spring boot) and I want to keep the offset information, so I thinked about using a ZoneDateTime object. But this is not working, my ZonedDateTime is 2024-04-12T08:39:23[UTC], offset is set to Z which is wrong, it's +2.

Why does it not handle the offset? Is there any other solution? Thank you.

EDIT:

Here is my post mapping:

@PostMapping(value = "/test",
        produces = MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN_VALUE)
@ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.OK)
public String test(
        @Valid
        @RequestBody
        TestObject test) {
    return "OK";
}

And my TestObject

package blabla;

import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.Setter;

import java.time.OffsetDateTime;

@Getter
@Setter
public class TestObject {
    private OffsetDateTime date;
}
